main event: A civilian in Tulsa, Oklahoma observed a bright, circular object in the sky on June 21, 1967.
interesting points: The object was approximately 30 feet in diameter and very bright.
It moved slowly at first, then suddenly accelerated at a tremendous rate of speed and disappeared from view.
The object remained visible for about 3 hours before rapidly accelerating and vanishing.
When the object left, it gave off a flash of light that illuminated the entire sky for a radius of at least 5 miles.
The observer felt certain the object was not a familiar aircraft.
sighted object: a bright, circular object in the sky
